name: packing, lime product | packing, lime product | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/8650/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of packing for lime products. Data is normalized with a annual production capacity of about 50'000 tons/year and an estimated lifespan of the machines of 25 years.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

Packing process starting from lime products, unpacked.

The activity ends with the packed products. The dataset includes the process of packing, transportation, and loading of the bags on paletts. The dataset also includes the machines, the waste treatment after use by the end-user of the lime products and the transports of the packing materials.
category: N:Administrative and support service activities/82:Office administrative, office support and other business support activities/829:Business support service activities n.e.c./8292:Packaging activities

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data is based on Swiss companies.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: Data corresponds to the current Swiss technology.;The process of packing the product into paper bags is fully automatic. Once filled, the bags are transported to a robot by conveyor belt. The robot piles them up on Euro-flat pallets. To ensure moisture protection, and for a better transportation the pallets are wrapped in a plastic foil.
processDocumentation.samplingDescription: Data is based on one Swiss company (KFN), with a annual production capacity of about 50'000 tons/year and estimated lifespan of the machines of 25 years.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=CH
Lime products are packed in paper bags and in paletts.

exchanges.description:
EcoSpold01Location=RER
Estimation. An average density of 800 kg/m3 is assumed. The pallet is assumed to be used 10 times before being disposed. A loaded pallet has an area of 1m2 and a height of 1 m, having a loading weight of 800 kg. The weight of the pallet is 22 kg. If two layers of plastic foil (including an overlay of 2 m) with a weight of 0.0123 kg/m2 are wrapped around, the amount of plastic per kg product is 0.000123 kg. 

Data is based on the information from the following website (accessed October 2003):
http://www.dm-folien.de/hpage.htm
